about.name: Phuket
about.info_text: Phuket is a beautiful island located in the south of Thailand. Known for its stunning beaches, crystal clear waters, and delicious cuisine, it is a popular destination for tourists from all over the world. Visitors can enjoy a variety of activities, from relaxing on the beach to exploring the island's natural beauty and cultural heritage. The city is also home to a bustling nightlife scene, with numerous bars, nightclubs, and restaurants to choose from.
about.facts_text:
Population: 416,582
Province: Phuket
Time Zone: Indochina Time (UTC+07:00)
Language: Thai
Currency: Thai baht (THB)
about.climate_text: Phuket has a tropical monsoon climate with high temperatures and high humidity year-round. The rainy season lasts from May to October, with the heaviest rainfall in September and October. The dry season runs from November to April, with the hottest months being March and April. Visitors should pack light, comfortable clothing and be prepared for occasional rain showers.

attractions_card.title: Beaches
attractions_card.description: Phuket is renowned for its beautiful beaches, which offer crystal-clear waters, white sand, and stunning views. Some of the top beaches to visit include Patong Beach, Karon Beach, and Kata Beach.

attractions_card.title: Big Buddha
attractions_card.description: This 45-meter-tall statue of Buddha is one of the most popular attractions in Phuket. Visitors can climb the stairs to the top of the statue and enjoy panoramic views of the island.

attractions_card.title: Phang Nga Bay
attractions_card.description: This stunning bay is known for its limestone cliffs, emerald-green waters, and picturesque islands. Visitors can take a boat tour of the bay and explore its many caves, lagoons, and secluded beaches.

attractions_card.title: Old Phuket Town
attractions_card.description: This historic neighborhood is filled with charming Sino-Portuguese architecture, colorful shophouses, and street art. Visitors can explore its many boutiques, cafes, and galleries and learn about the island's rich cultural heritage.

food_card.title: Pad Thai
food_card.description: Pad Thai is a stir-fried noodle dish that is popular in Thailand, including Phuket. Some of the best places to try Pad Thai in Phuket are Pad Thai Shop, Pad Thai Baan Nern Khao, and Pad Thai Thip Samai.

food_card.title: Tom Yum Goong
food_card.description: Tom Yum Goong is a spicy and sour soup that is often served with prawns. It is a popular dish in Thailand, and some of the best places to try it in Phuket are Krua Thai, Kan Eang @ Pier, and Laem Hin Seafood.

food_card.title: Thai Iced Tea
food_card.description: Thai Iced Tea is a sweet and creamy drink made with black tea, condensed milk, and sugar. It is a refreshing beverage to enjoy in the hot climate of Phuket, and some of the best places to try it are Cha Tra Mue, Naiharn Coffee, and Yentafo Convent.

hotels_card.title: Trisara Phuket
hotels_card.description: Trisara Phuket is a luxurious resort located on the northwest coast of Phuket. It offers spacious villas and suites with private pools, ocean views, and modern amenities. Amenities include a spa, beach club, and several dining options.

hotels_card.title: The Surin Phuket
hotels_card.description: The Surin Phuket is a beachfront resort located on the west coast of Phuket. It offers elegant rooms and suites with traditional Thai decor and modern amenities. Amenities include a spa, beach club, and several dining options.

hotels_card.title: Hostel Our Nomad
hotels_card.description: Hostel Our Nomad is a budget-friendly hostel located in the heart of Phuket Town. It offers dormitory and private rooms with shared bathrooms. Amenities include a common area, kitchen, and laundry facilities.

transport_card.title: Songthaew
transport_card.description: Songthaew is a shared taxi truck that is a popular mode of transportation in Phuket.
